comment.author: 59379275@N05
comment._content:
They knew how to build stuff back in the old days, a real temple of finance this one. In once proud towns like Hartlepool (and Darlington) banks used to use their financial might to build spectacularly ostentatios buildings and support British craftsmanship and industry in the process. After enduring the terrible side effects of speculative over-leveraged neoliberal economic mania for three decades these northern communities now face the economic and social blight of austerity 

I'd be glad to say that I'm away from the North East, but the situation is even worse in here in Spain, 23% unemployment and a right wing government reduced to begging and pleading with their IMF and European Central Bank creditors to stop insisting on even more economically toxic austerity measures. 

Ooops, that turned into a bit of a diatribe against the amoral free-marketeers.

Keep on posting these fascinating pictures.
